intro: Hieracium avellense, commonly known as the hazel hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and grassy areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its bright yellow flowers appear in late spring to early summer, and the plant produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium avellense is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
